A reckoning has emerged on American English, rife with words and phrases with racist origins or connotations“Sold down the river.” “Cakewalk.” “Master and slave.” American English is riddled with words and phrases with racist origins or undertones — and now a growing number of institutions are reevaluating their use of such language.

At Dartmouth, a student’s hunger strike over sexual harassment grows perilousThe campaign has forced Dartmouth’s hand, prompting it to agree to an external investigation. But perhaps even more significantly, it has revealed the profound distrust some students harbor over whether the university can fairly arbitrate allegations of sexual misconduct.
